item.title: Transmission of Information(1927)
item.description: In Transmission of Information, Hartley developed a quantitative measure of “information” in 1927. Hartley claims that information is the outcome of a selection among a finite set of possible messages. Shannon’s “A mathematical theory of communication”, which is based in part on Hartley’s ideas, published in 1947. Hartley did not model the source of information probabilistically. Shannon modeled the source of information as a random process. Hartley stated that information should be proportional to the number of selections for practical engineering value.
